holidays.name: National Underwear Day

holidays.name: National Oyster Day
holidays.description: A tasty tribute to the briny bivalve mollusks that have been enjoyed by coastal cultures for centuries. Perfect for seafood lovers to indulge in oysters raw, grilled, or fried!
holidays.origin: Began as an American food holiday to honor and celebrate the oyster‚Äôs culinary and ecological importance.
holidays.funFact: Oysters can filter up to 50 gallons of water a day, making them natural water purifiers and essential to ocean health.

holidays.name: Work Like a Dog Day
holidays.description: A humorous day to poke fun at hard work and hustle culture by comparing your effort to that of a hardworking dog, or to remind yourself to take breaks!
holidays.origin: An unofficial fun observance that encourages balancing diligence with play and relaxation.
holidays.funFact: Dogs often work to assist humans in tasks like herding, hunting, or rescue ‚Äî making this day a nod to their loyal work ethic.

holidays.name: National Friendship Day (UK)
holidays.description: A day to appreciate and celebrate the friendships that bring joy and support. Different countries observe Friendship Day on various dates; in the UK, it‚Äôs often celebrated on August 5.
holidays.origin: Friendship Day was first proposed in 1958 and adopted by many cultures worldwide on different days throughout summer.
